summary: Build a Threads-like social media app.
known_issues: App/page title is still set to "Threads" instead of "Josh" in the live deployment.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Minimalist “Josh” logo mark, clean modern style, high contrast, on transparent background (josh-logo.dim_512x512.png)

## Edit Images
- Replace the existing logo artwork with a Josh-appropriate logo (app-logo.dim_512x512.png > josh-logo.dim_512x512.png)

existing_features.title: Implement Internet Identity sign-in and gate authenticated actions (creating posts, following, liking, replying, reposting) behind authentication, while allowing unauthenticated users to browse a limited public feed.
Build the main app navigation and pages: Home feed, Explore/Search, Create Post composer, Profile (self and other users), and Post detail (thread view with replies).
Implement the posting experience similar to Threads: text-only post composer with character limit, inline validation, and optimistic UI updates for publishing to the feed.

Implement social interactions: follow/unfollow users, like/unlike posts, repost/unrepost posts, and reply to posts; reflect counts and user state (e.g., liked/reposted/following) consistently across the UI.

Provide a Threads-like feed algorithm baseline: Home feed for authenticated users prioritizing followed accounts (plus optionally a fallback of recent public posts), and a Public/Explore feed showing recent posts; support pagination/infinite scroll.
Add basic user discovery via search: search users by handle/display name and optionally search recent posts by keyword.

Apply a cohesive, original visual theme (not blue/purple) across the app with a distinct Threads-like minimal aesthetic: typographic hierarchy, spacing, post cards, icons, and consistent light mode styling.
Seed/demo experience: ensure a newly deployed app is usable by first users by supporting an initial empty state UX and optional backend-provided sample content toggle for local/demo environments.

Add a mobile-style bottom navigation bar (app-like tab bar) that appears on small screens and provides primary navigation to Home, Explore, Compose (authenticated only), and Profile (authenticated only), with clear active-state styling.
Update the app layout so page content is not obscured by the fixed bottom navigation bar on mobile (e.g., add safe-area-aware bottom padding/margin to the main content container).
Update all user-visible branding text from “Threads” to “Josh”, including the top-left header brand text and any other remaining “Threads” references in the UI.
Change the HTML document title to use “Josh” instead of the current Threads-based title text so that the browser tab/title reflects the new app name.
Add an appropriate “Josh” logo and update the app header branding to use it (replacing the current generated app logo asset usage where shown in the header).

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a Threads-like social media app (microblogging social network).

Create core backend data models and APIs for a Threads-like network: user profile (handle, display name, bio, avatar), posts (text, timestamp, author, reply-to), reposts, likes, and follow graph (following/followers).
Add a mobile-style bottom navigation bar (app-like tab bar) for primary sections of the app.
Rename/brand the app as "Josh" across UI and metadata (e.g., document/page title currently still shows "Threads").
Update deployment subdomain to be only "josh" instead of "josh-ulx".
Add an appropriate "Josh" logo and use it in the app branding (e.g., header/app icon where applicable).
Update the production deployment configuration so the app subdomain is exactly `josh` (not `josh-ulx`).
